metadata.dc:description: Secondary or metastatic vesical tumours are a very uncommon condition (less than 1% of vesical tumours). Dissemination routes are usually through blood and lymph, and diagnosis occurs typically in advanced stages. This paper presents one case of metastatic vesical neoplasia that developed 5 years after diagnosis of the primary lung tumour.
metadata.dc:title: Metástasis vesical de adenocarcinoma de pulmón.
[Bladder metastasis of lung adenocarcinoma].
